text:
Metamorphosis 2.0 | MAGIC: THE GATHERING
<http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/making-magic/metamorphosis-2-0-2017-06-12>

attachments.title: Metamorphosis 2.0
attachments.text: Changes are coming the Magic's block structure as the game continues to evolve over time.

text: Ooh, it's out
> All main Standard-legal expansions will be large, and all of them will be drafted alone.

> This also means that we are essentially removing the concept of blocks. Sets will share worlds on occasion, but the preset structure of a locked number of expansions being played together is no more.
As someone who drafts at home, this is huge. because now we can just buy one box, not this awkward buy two boxes and use only some cards
i'm pretty happy with this overall

TLDR:
no more large set / small set, 3x individual large sets that may or may not share a world
1x "core" set per year
materpieces only sometimes
I'm pretty happy with these changes.
i think good for edh too
we might see some more variety
I agree we should see more variety especially since cool legendaries are great ways to introduce a new world. Like Depala.
Not that she's great in edh, but a fun new idea.
maybe individual ideas will get less focus though
like vehicles.... even that didn't get enough support really for an edh deck
Yeah, that is a good point.
There have been a lot of mechanics that don't really even pick up a lot of steam with two blocks supporting it.
That's in standard I mean.
infect is the one in recent memory that actually created its own archetype
in edh
cant think of any other mechanic that people have built decks around
I guess they need to work on mechanics being less parasitic. Energy is kind of bad.
Does this free up space for more supplemental product?
Energy and true colorless are both purple mana
The best energy cards aren't parasitic but self-sustaining, such as Aetherworks Marvel and Demon of Dark Schemes.
True Colorless was silly
Demon of Dark Schemes is great. I like colorless cards more than I do energy because I can at least power them with cards I already want to play, like sol ring.
But yes both parasitic.
Yeah, personally not a fan of energy.
Maybe I'll like it more if they do it more.
I liked it, but it does need quite a few more cards.
If they made it deciduous I think I could come to enjoy it
I like it as another resource. Both Marvel & Demon slot into any reanimator deck.
I like that the masterpiece series is going to be a sometimes thing. Will make them more exciting.
That being said, I have enjoyed the effect masterpieces have had on prices
Agreed
I like the changes Maro
Maro laied out*
laid*
wow, I'm not good at typing today
they allow R&D to have more flexibility, which is a huge positive
Having the fluidity to do a one-off set seems like it really opens things up to take more chances, too. There's no way they'd go back to Kamigawa for a block but for a one-and-done set maybe.
Would make things like waterworld or Muraganda easier too
agreed
and I like having core sets back as small sets
more options here is better
Core sets could even be that one-shot throw back.
Good point
I'd almost like to see Conspiracy be the core set sometimes. They reprinted stuff from everywhere for Take the Crown.
That would let them get stuff like Council's Judgment into Modern...
How cool would that be?
As long as they get the draft-only stuff out of the rare slot. Just killed my desire to just pick up random packs.
well, the issue is core sets need to all be standard legal
You could still play Archdemon of Paliano in your constructed deck
so they would have to be careful what they're printing/reprinting
a lot of those cards were aimed at older formats
The only things that wouldn't be legal for constructed would be conspiracies.
sure I just meant they need to be careful not to print Baleful Strix level cards in to standard ( at least I think they do, maybe I'm wrong)
Considering MaRo believes reprinting Thoughseize was a mistake, I doubt they would do that anytime soon

Though I'd argue that was yet another "taking the wrong lesson" situation. Just like 4-mana wipes weren't the problem but instead a four mana wipe as awesome as Verdict in a meta with Sphinx's Rev, Aetherling, etc. was the really issue, the same feels true of Thoughtseize. Thoughtseize wasn't the issue, it was more Thoughtseize in a meta where monoblack was super strong already.
I'm half surprised Maro's takeway from CopyCat wasn't that cat beasts are OP
It surprises me what the lessons they pull from things, sometime they come from left field
I do hope the new testing team actually fixes some of those lessons
To my knowledge CopyCat's ETB is unique because it targets a permanent and immediately brings it back.
N
No chance you could abuse that.
nope nope nope, can't be done
I'm surprised I haven't seen it in more EDH builds yet.
I'm mean, with a clone and the cat you have infinite creature enter triggers.
Or the cat and Panharmonicon.
Though it has to target another permanent.
Still the potential value.
Being white hurts
Nah...in Jeskai you can do an easy Purph kill
Not saying it's impossible, just saying there's less decks wanting combo pieces that run white than say blue or black
honestly, I should PROBABLY put it in my breya build
it's on theme and everything
but I like that there are not inifinite combos in it

It's also a card that isn't super compelling solo. Mikaeus or dead-eye are strong even without a combo piece doing something broken, where as there's plenty of times you're gonna hate top-decking that cat.
today's mailbag
:grimacing:
Not sure if trolling or not
Is it literally the top edhrec cards reported?
Played a game against a creatureless Narset where an opponent played a card that made everyone mill until you hit a creature. Can't remember the card, but that took care of Narset.
[[telemin performance]]

attachments.fallback: Telemin Performance {3}{U}{U} // Sorcery // Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. That player puts all noncreature cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard, then you put the creature card onto the battlefield under your control.
attachments.text:
Sorcery
Target opponent reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. That player puts all noncreature cards revealed this way into his or her graveyard, then you put the creature card onto the battlefield under your control.
attachments.title: Telemin Performance {3}{U}{U}

text: There you go.
i like that card in mill/opponent graveyard strategies because unlike traumatize it actually gives you value
wish it was 4 mana or something
So meta
